src:
Backpacker Grace Millane embraces man suspected of killing her in date CCTV footage
CCTV footage showed to the jury showed Grace leaving Base Backpackers hostel and walking to nearby Sky City, where she met the man accused of murdering her
06 Nov 2019, 23:19 by Tom Davidson, Benjamin Cooper, https://www.mirror.co.uk/authors/tom-davidson/
Jurors in the Grace Millane murder trial have been shown footage of her meeting the man accused of murdering her.
Ms Millane, from Wickford, Essex, was on a round-the-world trip when she arrived in New Zealand last November and went on a Tinder date with the 27-year-old man now accused of her murder.
The court was shown security footage of Ms Millane leaving Base Backpackers hostel and walking to nearby Sky City, where she met the defendant and embraced him.
They are then seen going inside to Andy's Burgers & Bar, where they drank together before departing to drink some jugs of sangria at Mexican Cafe.
Ms Millane is shown resting her chin briefly on the defendant's shoulder as he pays for their drinks at the cafe.


The accused is seen embracing the backpacker in this screenshot



CCTV of the pair at a bar shortly before Grace's death

Cameras on the street show the pair then walking and intermittently holding hands on the way to Bluestone Room, where they sit at a table inside the front door.
They spend just over an hour at the venue, during which the defendant leans across and kisses Ms Millane lightly, before then putting his hand on the back of her head and kissing her in a more sustained manner.
They continue kissing and talking for a while, then leave and walk arm-in-arm down the street and into the lobby of CityLife at 9.40pm.


Grace and the accused went on a date after chatting on Tinder



Grace, from Essex, vanished on the eve of her 22nd birthday

They enter the lifts and Ms Millane follows the accused out of the lift at 9.41pm toward where the defendant was living.
It is the last time she is seen alive.
A "significant amount" of security footage was analysed following Grace Millane's disappearance, a court has heard.
Detective Adam Bicknell told Auckland High Court that "just short of six terrabytes of data, which is a significant amount" was examined as part of Operation Gourami.


The 27-year-old man has been accused of murdering Grace



Grace's body was found in the Waitakere Ranges in December last year (Image: Getty Images)

He said that officers looked at footage from various bars Ms Millane visited while on a date with her accused killer.
However, he said "the majority" of the footage came from 14 cameras over a period of six days at CityLife Auckland, the hotel where the man alleged to have strangled her was staying and the last place she was seen alive.


Grace's parents, David (centre) and Gillian, with Detective Inspector Scott Beard (Image: Getty Images)



Grace was on a round-the-world trip when she died (Image: Collect Unknown)

The Crown has alleged that the defendant, who cannot be named for legal reasons, strangled Ms Millane during rough sexual intercourse.
The defence claims the death, on either December 1 or December 2 2018, the date of Ms Millane's 22nd birthday, was accidental.
Phone records allegedly showed the defendant had searched online for "the hottest fire", "large bags near me" and "Waitakere Ranges" - where Ms Millane's body was later found contorted inside a suitcase - before going on another Tinder date later that day.

Top news stories from Mirror Online
